intro: Prionosciadium diversifolium, commonly known as the broad-leaved cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate to ovate leaves and its tall, branched flowering stems. The flowers are small, white, and arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. The plant is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in herbal medicine.
